Make a theta_join node.

Theta join is a join on an arbitrary predicate.

theta_join_se(a, b, expr, ..., jointype = "INNER", suffix = c("_a", "_b"),
  env = parent.frame())

Arguments

a

source to select from.
b

source to select from.
expr

quoated join condition
...

force later arguments to be by name
jointype

type of join ('INNER', 'LEFT', 'RIGHT', 'FULL').
suffix

character length 2, suffices to disambiguate columns.
env

environment to look for values in.

Value

theta_join node.

Examples


my_db <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")
d1 <- dbi_copy_to(my_db, 'd1',
                 data.frame(AUC = 0.6, R2 = 0.2))
d2 <- dbi_copy_to(my_db, 'd2',
                 data.frame(AUC2 = 0.4, R2 = 0.3))
eqn <- theta_join_se(d1, d2, "AUC >= AUC2")
cat(format(eqn))
#> table('d1') %.>%
#>  theta_join(.,
#>   table('d2'),
#>   j= INNER; on= AUC >= AUC2)
sql <- to_sql(eqn, my_db)
cat(sql)
#> SELECT
#>  `tsql_07018573943616888258_0000000000`.`AUC` AS `AUC`,
#>  `tsql_07018573943616888258_0000000000`.`R2` AS `R2_a`,
#>  `tsql_07018573943616888258_0000000001`.`AUC2` AS `AUC2`,
#>  `tsql_07018573943616888258_0000000001`.`R2` AS `R2_b`
#> FROM (
#>  SELECT
#>   `d1`.`AUC`,
#>   `d1`.`R2`
#>  FROM
#>   `d1`
#> ) `tsql_07018573943616888258_0000000000`
#> INNER JOIN (
#>  SELECT
#>   `d2`.`AUC2`,
#>   `d2`.`R2`
#>  FROM
#>   `d2`
#> ) `tsql_07018573943616888258_0000000001` ON `AUC` >= `AUC2`
DBI::dbGetQuery(my_db, sql)
#>   AUC R2_a AUC2 R2_b
#> 1 0.6  0.2  0.4  0.3
DBI::dbDisconnect(my_db)
